node.title: ACT records seven new COVID-19 cases, one a close contact of Omicron infection
node.alt: a sign saying rapid antigen testing at a building site
node.description: The ACT records seven new COVID-19 cases, including one which is confirmed as a close contact of Canberra's first Omicron infection.
node.content:
["The ACT has recorded seven new COVID-19 cases\u00a0as authorities remain on high alert to the\u00a0Omicron variant,\u00a0confirmed to be in the territory.", "One of today's seven new cases is a close contact of the Omicron case announced by ACT Health yesterday.\u00a0", "ACT Health\u00a0confirmed that genomic sequencing was\u00a0underway to determine whether that case was also\u00a0the Omicron variant, but said it might\u00a0be some time until the result was\u00a0returned.", "The\u00a0positive Omicron case announced yesterday had\u00a0not travelled overseas, is fully vaccinated and returned a positive COVID-19 test on Wednesday, December 1.", "Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith said authorities believed the case originated from New South Wales, and were working with NSW Health to identify the source of the Omicron infection.\u00a0", "Yesterday, ACT Health announced four known exposure sites linked to the new Omicron case, which were all listed as casual contact sites.", "They were:", "Anybody who attended an exposure location at the specified time and date must fill out an\u00a0ACT Contact Declaration Form\u00a0and get tested.", "
Quarantine requirements change for close contacts of Omicron cases
", "", "
Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith thanked Canberrans\u00a0in quarantine for\u00a0helping to keep\u00a0the rest of the community safe.(ABC News: Ian Cutmore)
", "Speaking today, Ms Stephen-Smith\u00a0said the quarantine requirements for close contacts of a confirmed Omicron case had changed.", "Now, all close contacts of an Omicron case must quarantine for 14 days, regardless of their vaccination status.", "The\u00a0rule also applies to secondary contacts of a close contact, which is anyone living in the same home as a close contact of an Omicron case.", "The quarantine requirements have not changed for casual contact.", "Ms Stephen-Smith said the government was taking a \"precautionary approach\" until more information emerged about the Omicron variant.", "\"And that is why ACT health authorities are taking a precautionary approach in increasing the quarantine requirements, even for people that are fully vaccinated, and adding those quarantine requirements for secondary household contacts at this time.\"", "Ms Stephen-Smith said she acknowledged the challenges with quarantining at this time of the year, but was grateful to the Canberra community for their support of public health measures.", "\"We recognise that this is difficult for those people who have to quarantine and particularly for those people whose whole household has to go into quarantine for 14 days,\" she said.", "
Pop-up testing clinic at Dickson College
", "To support an expected increase in testing, ACT Health\u00a0announced it was establishing\u00a0a pop-up testing clinic at Dickson College, which opens today.", "The increase in testing capacity and the territory's first confirmed Omicron case comes as the ACT reached 98 per cent of its eligible population with full vaccination coverage.", "There are currently six people in hospital as a result of the virus, including three people in intensive care. No patients require ventilation.", "Earlier this morning, the South Australian Premier Stephen Marshall announced that while the borders would remain open to ACT residents, anyone wanting to enter South Australia must\u00a0receive a test on arrival and quarantine until a negative result is received, and then get another test on day six.\u00a0"]
